hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime BTC Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence >60%) with 20-day realized volatility below 40% and Bollinger Band width (20,2) compresses to the 20th percentile of its 90-day range, a breakout above the upper Bollinger Band on >1.5x average volume will initiate a short-term bullish momentum phase targeting a 5% move, invalidated if price re-enters the bands within 48 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often represent consolidation and indecision. Severe volatility compression in this state indicates a buildup of potential energy. A high-volume breakout from this compression, while still in a neutral macro regime, suggests a localized regime shift to bullish momentum before the broader regime classification changes, offering an early edge.
entry_conditions: BTC Bollinger Band (20,2) width <= 20th percentile of its 90-day range
BTC price closes > upper Bollinger Band
BTC volume on breakout candle > 1.5x 20-day average volume

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price closes back inside Bollinger Bands
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 days if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 50% of such breakout signals fail to achieve a 5% move before price re-enters the Bollinger Bands, or the average win rate is below 55% over 20 instances.
